result.execSummary:
The defendant Guadalupe Jose Rivas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by April 17, 2017;  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by April 17, 2017;  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Restitution set at zero

Consecutive to: (to be served in the Wisconsin Prison System), consecutive to any other sentence and to defendant's revocation, STRAIGHT TIME.
No drivers license suspension.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Guadalupe Jose Rivas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Guadalupe Jose Rivas in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Guadalupe Jose Rivas in custody.  David John Behm for Marissa Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 5 months in the House of Correction (to be served in the Wisconsin Prison System), consecutive to any other sentence and to defendant's revocation, STRAIGHT TIME with credit for 0 days time served.  
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by April 17, 2017;  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by April 17, 2017;  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Restitution set at zero
-no drivers license suspension

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court, defendant Guadalupe Jose Rivas not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Additional time requested to conduct the plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court, defendant Guadalupe Jose Rivas not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.

Defendant Guadalupe Jose Rivas in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Guadalupe Jose Rivas in custody.  Brandon Wigley for Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court ordered all costs and surcharges waived.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Guadalupe Jose Rivas in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Guadalupe Jose Rivas in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
